intro: Genoplesium brachystachyum, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed sun-orchid, is an Australian endemic orchid species belonging to the Orchidaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, often hairy stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in heathlands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually arranged in a spike and are pollinated by insects, particularly bees. Genoplesium brachystachyum is a rare and threatened species, requiring conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
